==History== It was first announced in October 2011 to host the [[Grand Prix of America]], a race of the [[Fédération Internationale de l'Automobile|FIA]] [[Formula One|Formula One World Championship]]. Originally intended to debut on the calendar in {{F1|2013}},<ref>{{cite news |last=Elizalde |first=Pablo |title=New Jersey confirms F1 grand prix from the 2013 season |publisher=[[Haymarket Group|Haymarket Publications]] |work=autosport.com |url=http://www.autosport.com/news/report.php/id/95669 |date=25 October 2011 |accessdate=26 October 2011}}</ref> the race was subject to a series of postponements and delays stemming from financial difficulties, failure to obtain approval from the FIA, a lack of preparedness from organisers, and a [[breach of contract|contractual dispute]].<ref name="NJ delay">{{cite news |title=New Jersey Grand Prix to be postponed until 2014 |url=http://www.autosport.com/news/report.php/id/103529 |work=Autosport.com |publisher=[[Haymarket Media |accessdate=2013-12-04}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=Sylt |first=Christian |title=New Jersey Grand Prix organizers in breach of contract says Ecclestone Formula One boss says if another group wants to take over Grand Prix of America, 'they can have it' |publisher=Auto Week |date=December 24, 2013 |url=http://www.autoweek.com/article/20131224/F1/131229938 |accessdate=2013-12-24}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last=Strunsky |first=Steve |title=Formula 1 welcoming new NYC-area race proposals, report says |publisher=The Star-Ledger |date=December 24, 2013 |url=http://www.nj.com/news/index.ssf/2013/12/formula_1_hudson_other_sponsors.html#incart_river_default |accessdate=2013-12-24}}</ref>
When the inaugural 2013 race was dropped from the calendar, Formula One President and CEO [[Bernie Ecclestone]] stated that the promoters were in breach of contract and that new proposals from other parties would be welcome.<ref>{{cite news |last=Sylt |first=Christian |title=New Jersey Grand Prix organizers in breach of contract says Ecclestone Formula One boss says if another group wants to take over Grand Prix of America, 'they can have it' |publisher=Auto Week |date=December 24, 2013 |url=http://www.autoweek.com/article/20131224/F1/131229938 |accessdate=2013-12-24}}</ref> The race was repeatedly added then removed from future Formula One provisional calendars, and dropped completely from even the provisional calendar by {{F1|2016}}.<ref>{{cite press release |title=World Motor Sport Council 2014 - Beijing |publisher=FIA |date=September 4, 2014 |url=http://www.fia.com/news/world-motor-sport-council-2014-beijing |accessdate=2014-09-12}}</ref>
In 2014, [[FIA Formula E Championship|Formula E]] chief executive Alejandro Agag revealed that he had been working with promoters to bring that series to the proposed Port Imperial Circuit, but later (2016) settled on a circuit in the Brooklyn industrial area instead after the continued failure to launch the Formula One race.<ref name=FormulaE>{{cite news |url=http://www.speedcafe.com/2016/09/22/formula-e-reveals-new-york-street-circuit/ |title=Formula E reveals New York street circuit |publisher=speedcafe.com |accessdate=22 September 2016}}</ref>
==Location and design== [[File:10.7.09BoulevardEast&60thSTByLuigiNovi1.jpg|thumb|left|The junction of Boulevard East and Hillside Avenue at the circuit's highest point.]]
The site of the circuit was made after several years of searching for an appropriate venue in the [[New York Metropolitan Area]] and was chosen for its location near the [[North River (Hudson River)|Hudson River]] and [[Hudson Palisades]], offering sweeping skyline views, elevation changes and access to public transportation.<ref name="WSJ"/>
The circuit, designed by German track designer [[Hermann Tilke]], will run clockwise. The start line is planned to be located next to the [[NY Waterway]] ferry terminal, with the pits and paddock located between the ferry terminal and Port Imperial Boulevard. The first sector of the circuit will run along the [[Hudson River Waterfront Walkway]], designed to allow the cars to race through Port Imperial before climbing the Hudson Palisades along [[Pershing Road (Weehawken)|Pershing Road]]. The circuit will then follow [[Boulevard East]] north to Donnelly Memorial Park where it will turn right and descend Hillside Avenue to a [[hairpin turn]] adjacent to the West New York sewage treatment plant. The circuit will then return south to the ferry terminal via Port Imperial Boulevard.<ref name="WSJ"/><ref>{{Citation |last=Torres |first=Agustin C. |title=Formula One racing is a done deal for Hudson County's 'Monte Carlo' |newspaper=The Jersey Journal |date=25 October 2011 |url=http://www.nj.com/hudson/voices/index.ssf/2011/10/formula_one_racing_is_a_done_d.html |accessdate=2011-10-29}}</ref> The elevation change from Port Imperial to the Palisades, some {{convert|150|ft|m|abbr=off|sp=us}},<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.statesman.com/sports/formula1/new-jersey-will-host-second-f1-event-in-1934006.html |title=New Jersey will host second F1 event in U.S. |last=Maher |first=John |date=25 October 2011 |work=Austin American-Statesman |accessdate=2011-10-26 |location=Austin, TX |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111028211728/http://www.statesman.com/sports/formula1/new-jersey-will-host-second-f1-event-in-1934006.html |archivedate=28 October 2011 |df= }}</ref> would give the circuit one of the greatest elevation changes on the calendar.<ref name="F1B">{{cite web |url=http://www.formula1blog.com/2011/04/14/vox-certatus-texas-is-flat-so-there-will-be-no-elevation-changes/ |title=Vox Certatus: ‘Texas is flat so there will be no elevation changes’ |last=Greene |first=Tony |date=14 April 2011 |publisher=Formula1Blog |accessdate=2011-10-26}}</ref>
Although the circuit will pass residential areas, residents will not be cut off from their homes; the organizers plan to provide access to the seven affected residences. The organizers further plan to fund the race without any public money.<ref name="WSJ"/><ref>{{Citation |last=Pope |first=Gennarose |title=Three-day race hits local streets in 2013 |newspaper=Hudson Reporter |date=30 October 2011 |url=http://www.hudsonreporter.com/view/full_story/16214733/article-Three-day-race-hits-local-streets-in-2013-Formula-One-cars-in-WNY--Weehawken-could-peak-at-200-MPH-? |accessdate=2011-11-05}}</ref>
==Promotional runs== In June 2012, [[Sebastian Vettel]] did a promotional test run along the proposed route describing it as "exceptional" before going on to add that it would become a favourite among drivers.<ref name = vettel/> Commenting on the elevation changes and turns he said he was reminded of the [[Circuit de Spa-Francorchamps]] and the [[Circuit de Monaco]].<ref>{{cite news |last=Mayersohn |first=Norman |title=Sebastian Vettel Gets Loose on the Grand Prix Circuit in New Jersey |newspaper=The New York Times |date=June 12, 2012 |url=http://wheels.blogs.nytimes.com/2012/06/12/sebastian-vettel-gets-loose-on-the-grand-prix-circuit-in-new-jersey/ |accessdate=2013-06-13 |quote=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last=Benson |first=Andrew |title=F1 champion Sebastian Vettel happy with New Jersey circuit |publisher=BBC |date=June 13, 2012 |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/formula1/18429084 |accessdate=2013-06-13 |quote=The change of elevation is something we really enjoy. A street circuit is always special. It's always very technical. You have these bumps built in and even if you resurface the track, you still have these bumps but it's part of the track. It gives the circuit a bit of soul and it's good for us for orientation and even if it feels rough it belongs to the circuit.}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=Stunsky |first=Steve |title=Formula 1 champ races through Grand Prix test run in Weehawken, West New York |newspaper=the Jersey Journal |date=June 11, 2012 |url=http://www.nj.com/news/index.ssf/2012/06/formula_1_champ_races_through.html |accessdate=2013-03-20 |quote=}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=Torres |first=Augustin |title=F1 driver takes me along on a test run of the Grand Prix of America route in North Hudson |newspaper=The Jersey Journal |date=June 11, 2012 |url=http://www.nj.com/hudson/voices/index.ssf/2012/06/f1_driver_take_me_along_on_a_t.html |accessdate=2013-03-22 |quote=}}</ref> According to Vettel, the circuit will be made up of "quick, floating corners", and he expects cars will reach speeds of over 200 mph, with the net result being that the circuit will reward the bravest drivers.<ref name = vettel>{{cite news |last=Zeitlinger |first=Ron |title=Slick new video shows Red Bull F1 car racing through Hudson County |newspaper=The Jersey Journal |date=August 30, 2012 |url=http://www.nj.com/hudson/index.ssf/2012/08/slick_new_video_shows_red_bull.html |accessdate=2013-06-15 |quote=}}</ref> In August 2012, [[David Coulthard]] drove portions of the course to test out the roadways as part of the creation of a promotional video for [[Red Bull Racing]] featuring the street circuit and environs.<ref>{{cite news |last=Scrivner |first=Micheal |title=Formula 1 Grand Prix driver tests out portions of Hudson County race course |newspaper=The Jersey Journal |date=August 15, 2012 |accessdate=2013-03-22 |url=http://www.nj.com/hudson/index.ssf/2012/08/formula_1_grand_prix_driver_te.htm |quote=...tested sections of the proposed 3.1-mile race course...to see how a high performance vehicle would react to imperfections in the roadways. "We were wondering about the cracks and everything in the roads, but I don't think they're an issue.}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=Roberts |first=Christine |title=Go Speed Racer Go! Pro driver whizzes through Lincoln Tunnel - in under 30 seconds |newspaper=The Daily News |date=August 16, 2012 |url=http://www.nydailynews.com/new-york/speed-racer-pro-driver-whizzes-lincoln-tunnel-30-seconds-article-1.1138191 |accessdate=2013-06-15 |quote=}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=David Coulthard drives F1 car at 190mph through Lincoln Tunnel in New York |newspaper=The Telegraph |date=August 17, 2012 |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/motorsport/formulaone/9484141/David-Coulthard-drives-F1-car-at-190mph-through-Lincoln-Tunnel-in-New-York.html |accessdate=2013-06-15 |quote=}}</ref>
==Construction planning== [[File:Weehawken Port Imperial Ferry Terminal on Hudson River.jpg|thumb|left|The Weehawken Port Imperial ferry terminal, adjacent to the start/finish line.]] Event organiser [[Leo Hindery]] announced in June 2013 that the race has received all necessary local permits and that 31 contractors were engaged in preparation work for the course.<ref>{{cite news |last=Strunsky |first=Steve |title=Local Formula 1 organizer says he has new contract, NJ race on schedule for June 2014 |newspaper=Jersey Journal |date=June 7, 2013 |url=http://www.nj.com/news/index.ssf/2013/06/local_formula_1_organizer_says.html |accessdate=2013-06-07 |quote=}}</ref> The circuit will consist entirely of existing roads, removing the need to build any sections of circuit exclusively for the race,<ref name="WSJ"/> with the exception of the [[pit stop#Formula One|pit lane]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://formula-one.speedtv.com/article/f1-formula-one-to-race-in-new-jersey-in-2013/ |title=Formula One To Race In New Jersey In 2013 |date=25 October 2011 |publisher=SPEED Channel |accessdate=2011-10-27 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111026200147/http://formula-one.speedtv.com/article/f1-formula-one-to-race-in-new-jersey-in-2013 |archivedate=26 October 2011 |df= }}</ref> A contract between the municipalities and the race promoters was signed in June 2013.<ref>{{cite news |last=Torres |first=Augustin C. |title=Political Insider: Weehawken and West New York sign new 15-year contract with F1 race promoters |newspaper=The Jersey Journal |date=June 22, 2013 |url=http://www.nj.com/hudson/voices/index.ssf/2013/06/political_insider_weehawken_an.html |accessdate=2013-11-15 |quote=}}</ref> That month, a long-awaited bridge between the building and the [[Port Imperial (HBLR station)|Port Imperial]] [[Hudson–Bergen Light Rail]] station, seen as an important component of public access to the circuit was opened.<ref>{{cite news |last=Wenik |first=Ian |title=Open at last - After long wait, pedestrian bridge connects light rail and ferry |newspaper=Hudson Reporter |date=June 9, 2013 |url=http://www.hudsonreporter.com/view/full_story/22842871/article-Open-at-last-After-long-wait--pedestrian-bridge-connects-light-rail-and-ferry-?instance=more_page |accessdate=2013-07-11 |quote=}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=Cichowksi |first=John |title=Road Warrior: $9.7M footbridge needs more feet |newspaper=The Record |date=June 11, 2013 |url=http://www.northjersey.com/columnists/cichowski/Road_Warrior_97M_footbridge_needs_more_feet.html?c=y&page=1 |accessdate=2013-07-11 |quote=}}</ref>
Construction of a previously planned parking garage at the NY Waterway ferry terminal began in July 2012,<ref>{{cite web |title=Weehawken Twp. and Roseland Property Company Break Ground on Ferry Parking Garage at Port Imperial |author=Cahn Roundup |date=July 7, 2011 |url=http://cahnroundup.com/2011/07/07/weehawken-twp-and-roseland-property-company-break-ground-on-ferry-parking-garage-at-port-imperial/ |accessdate=2013-04-25}}</ref> which is intended for use as race headquarters and paddock,<ref name=prepares>{{cite news |last=Jones |first=Satcy |title=New Jersey's Gold Coast prepares for roaring engines of Formula One racers with eye on 2013 start |newspaper=The Star-Ledger |date=July 8, 2012 |url=http://www.nj.com/business/index.ssf/2012/07/new_jerseys_gold_coast_prepare.html |accessdate=2013-03-20 |quote=}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=Pope |first=Jennifer |title=Building boom on the waterfront |newspaper=Hudson Reporter |date=December 31, 1969 [sic] |url=http://hudsonreporter.com/pages/full_stories_home/push?article-Building+boom+on+the+waterfront-Officials+break+ground+for+million-dollar+residences-%20&id=19849346&instance=weehawken_story_left_column |accessdate=2013-03-22 |quote=... an 800-space parking garage and headquarters for the 2013 Port Imperial Grand Prix Formula One race is heading toward completion as well.}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=Strunsky |first=Steve |title=N.J. Formula 1 race, more bumps in the road |newspaper=The Star-Ledger |date=May 8, 2013 |url=http://www.nj.com/news/index.ssf/2013/05/for_nj_formula_1_race_more_bum.html#incart_river |accessdate=2013-05-08 |quote=}}</ref> with space for twenty-four pit garages.<ref>{{cite news |title=N.J. Formula One Race Is 'Definitely On' |url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB10001424127887324299104578531323487479656 |first=A.J. |last=Baine |work=[[The Wall Street Journal]] |publisher=Lex Fenwick |date=7 June 2013 |accessdate=8 June 2013}}</ref> As envisioned, the ground floor of the building will normally function as retail space, to be transformed each year for use by the race.<ref name=prepares/> Construction was completed in the Summer of 2013. In November 2013 ground was broken for two hotels to be built above the parking facility.<ref>{{cite news |last=Sibayan |first=Rose |title=Weehawken breaks ground for two hotels to rise above Port Imperial parking garage |newspaper=The Jersey Journal |date=November 14, 2013 |url=http://www.nj.com/jjournal-news/index.ssf/2013/11/weehawken_breaks_ground_for_tw.html |accessdate=2013-11-16 |quote=}}</ref>
Resurfacing and other work on the roads to be used was planned for August to November 2013.<ref>{{cite press release |title=FORMULA 1: Bus Route Nos. 23, 128, 165, 166 and 168: Boulevard East Detours due to Construction Work for Formula 1 - Beginning Mid-August 2013 |publisher=New Jersey Transit |date=August 13, 2013 |url=http://m.njtransit.com/mo/mo_servlet.srv?hdnPageAction=ServiceAdjustmentTo&AdjustmentId=10255&From=Bus |accessdate=2013-08-31}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=New Jersey F1 Race Promoter Hindery Jr. Says 'We Are Back Under Construction' |url=http://www.sportsbusinessdaily.com/Global/Issues/2013/03/08/Events-and-Attractions/New-Jersey-F1.aspx |first=HJ |last=Mai |work=SportsBusiness Journal |date=March 8, 2013 |accessdate=March 8, 2013}}</ref> In order to create a smooth surface, repaving was to be done in a staggered line or "echelon" so that asphalt will not cool as lanes are poured. It remained to be determined whether potential obstacles such as fire hydrants and traffic lights would have been moved.<ref name=prepares/>
It was considered for the barriers used for the defunct [[Valencia Street Circuit]] to be used for the circuit.<ref>{{cite web |last= |first= |title=Valencia F1 barriers to be used at New Jersey F1 track |publisher=Grand Prix 47 |date=October 18, 2013 |url=http://grandprix247.com/2013/10/18/valencia-f1-barriers-to-be-used-at-new-jersey-f1-track/ |format= |doi= |accessdate=2013-10-31}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last=Seward |first=John |title=How recycling can help new F1 circuits prosper |publisher=Auto Car |date=October 25, 2013 |url=http://www.autocar.co.uk/blogs/f1-2013/how-recycling-can-help-new-f1-circuits-prosper |accessdate=2013-10-31}}</ref> {{clear}}
==Formula E== According to a March 2014 report in ''[[Forbes]]'', [[FIA Formula E Championship|Formula E]] chief executive Alejandro Agag revealed that he had been working with promoters to bring the series to the New York area, but that he was waiting to see how the financial situation surrounding the Grand Prix was resolved before he could commit to bringing the Formula E series to the city.<ref>{{cite web |last=Sylt |first=Christian |title=Formula E "Working With New York" On Street Race |publisher=Forbes |date=March 28, 2014 |url=http://www.nj.com/news/index.ssf/2014/04/if_formula_e_could_replace_f-1_as_new_yorks_grand_prix_report_says.html#incart_m-rpt-1 |accessdate=2014-04-05}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=Strunsky |first=Steve |title=Formula E could replace F-1 as New York's grand prix, report says |newspaper=The Jersey Journal |date=April 4, 2014 |url=http://www.nj.com/news/index.ssf/2014/04/if_formula_e_could_replace_f-1_as_new_yorks_grand_prix_report_says.html#incart_m-rpt-1 |accessdate=2014-04-05}}</ref> With the continued failure to launch the Formula One race, with associated development of the Port Imperial Street Circuit, Agag later (2016) settled on a circuit that will utilize the Brooklyn industrial area instead.<ref name=FormulaE/>
==References== {{reflist|2}}
==External links== {{Commons category}} *{{Citation |last=Donahue |first=Brian |title=New Jersey's Grand Prix of America Formula 1 racetrack: the pedal power tour |newspaper=The Star-Ledger |pages= |year= |date=October 31, 2011 |url=http://www.nj.com/ledgerlive/index.ssf/2011/10/new_jerseys_grand_prix_of_amer.html}} *{{Citation |last=Kilgannon |first=Corey |title=Imagining Local Roads as the Scene of a Race |newspaper=The New York Times |date=November 7, 2011 |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2011/11/08/nyregion/driving-a-future-formula-one-route-but-in-traffic.htm}} *[https://archive.is/20130913044049/http://goo.gl/maps/Yosgw Port Imperial Street Circuit on Google Maps]

revision.text:
{{Refimprove|date=June 2007}} [[Image:Portuguese bullfight.jpg|Cavaleiro and bull|280px|thumb]] '''Portuguese-style [[bullfighting]]''' differs in many aspects from [[Spanish-style bullfighting]]. The ''cavaleiros'' and the ''forcados'' are unique as well as the horsewomen (''cavaleiras'').
==Main figures== * ''Cavaleiros'' - A horseman or woman (rider), dressed in traditional 18th century costumes fights the bull from horseback. The horses are [[List of horse breeds|Portuguese Lusitanos]], specially trained for the fights. These horses are usually skilled in ''[[dressage]]'' and may exhibit their art in the arena. The purpose of this fight is to stab three or four ''bandarilhas'' (small [[spear|javelin]]s) in the back of the bull. In the past, horseback bullfighters were often members of old aristocratic families. The horsewomen (''cavaleiras'') are a pioneer and unique feature of the Portuguese bullfighting. [[Ana Batista]], [[Sónia Matias (bullfighter)|Sónia Matias]], [[Ana Rita]] and [[Joana Andrade]] are among the first and most renowned ''cavaleiras'' of Portugal. * ''Forcados'' - The [[forcado]]s are a group of eight men who challenge the bull directly, without any protection or weapon of defense. The front man provokes the bull into a charge to perform a ''pega de cara'' or ''pega de caras'' (face catch). The front man secures the animal's head and is quickly aided by his fellows who surround and secure the animal until he is subdued. Forcados were usually people from lower classes who, to this day, practice their art through amateur associations. In California, these men sometimes take the humorous nickname of 'Suicide Squad'. * ''Matadores'' - Same as the Spanish ''[[Torero#Matador de Toros|matadores]]'', but they do not kill the bull in the end. * ''Bandarilheiros'' - These men are the matador's and/or cavaleiro's helpers in the arena. They are skillful and wear the suit of light as the matador, except not with the gold sequins. While in the arena, they are holding the gold/pink cape to distract or position the bull.
==Stages== Most Portuguese bullfights (''corridas de touros'') are held in two phases: the spectacle of the ''cavaleiro'', followed by the ''pega''. In Portugal, the main stars of bullfighting are the ''cavaleiros'', as opposed to Spain, where the ''matadores'' are the most prominent bullfighters. Nevertheless, bullfights with matadores are frequent, notably with Portuguese matadores who practice their trade in Spain and who, when in Portugal, replace the sword in their final strike with a ''bandarilha''. Examples of famous Portuguese matadores are [[Vítor Mendes]] and [[Pedrito de Portugal]].
During the ''cavaleiro'', a horseman on a [[List of horse breeds|Portuguese Lusitano]] horse (specially trained for the fights) fights the bull from horseback. The purpose of this fight is to stab three or four ''bandeirilhas'' (small [[spear|javelin]]s) in the back of the bull.
[[Image:Pega de caras.jpg|thumb|280px|Pega de caras]] In the second stage, called the ''pega'', the [[forcado]]s, a group of eight men, challenge the bull directly without any protection or weapon of defense. The front man provokes the bull into a charge to perform a ''pega de cara'' or ''pega de caras'' (face catch). The front man secures the animal's head and is quickly aided by his fellows who surround and secure the animal until he is subdued. Many people who watch Portuguese-style bullfights in the United States use the term, "suicide squad", to refer to this group of eight men.
The bull is not killed, at the end of the ''corrida'', leading oxen are let into the arena and two ''campinos'' on foot herd the bull along them back to its pen. After the fight the bull may be either killed by a professional butcher or, after a good performance, restored to health and released to pasture for breeding.{{Citation needed|date=January 2008}} Nevertheless, tradition was so strong at the small frontier town of [[Barrancos]], where the bull was illegally killed, that the government was forced to relent and permit the town to follow its ancient ''matador'' tradition and kill the bull.
There are other forms of traditional bullfighting in Portugal, some differing markedly from the version described above. In the [[Azores]], bullfighting is often reminiscent of the running of the bulls in [[Pamplona]] (Spain) in the respect that those most at risk are human beings, not the bulls themselves. The Azorean style involves a group of people vying in a [[tug-of-war]] with a young bull by holding fast to a long stout rope tied around the bull's neck. This is called the ''[[tourada à corda]]'' (bull-on-a-rope 'game').
==Hazards== {{See also|Bullfighting}} In Portugal, some bulls have their horns severed and covered in a way that they do not present sharp points. This practice is believed to have been introduced by King [[Joseph I of Portugal]] after a tragic event in a bullfight over which he was presiding at [[Salvaterra de Magos]]. The son and heir of the 4th [[Marquis of Marialva]] was fighting a bull on horseback when the animal wounded his horse. The young man fell, was kicked by the bull and killed. The Marquis himself, then around 70 years of age, jumped from the royal cabin that he shared with the king, drew his sword and killed the animal.
===Geographic distribution===
Some southern and central regions of Portugal, such as [[Ribatejo Province|Ribatejo]] and parts of the [[Alentejo]], as well as [[Terceira Island]] in the Azores, are traditionally more interested in the ''corrida de touros''. In Portugal's northern regions, bullfighting has a much lower presence, except for [[Póvoa de Varzim]] where bullfighting arenas are known to exist, at various locations, since the 18th century. In Northern Portugal, [[Viana do Castelo]] prohibited bullfighting in 2009,<ref>http://www.jn.pt/paginainicial/pais/concelho.aspx?Distrito=Viana+do+Castelo&Concelho=Viana+do+Castelo&Option=Interior&content_id=1156218</ref> However, the arena was only used once a year since the 1990s and its bullfighting locations can be traced to 1871. In July 2018, the Póvoa de Varzim municipality has also announced a bullfighting ban, starting January 1 2019<ref>http://www.cm-pvarzim.pt/noticias/povoa-de-varzim-declara-se-anti-touradas</ref>. It is entirely absent from most Azorean islands and from [[Madeira Islands|Madeira]].
The public television station [[Rádio e Televisão de Portugal|RTP]] usually shows bullfights in prime-time. This has been notoriously criticized by left-wing parties who have tried to ban the programme<ref>http://www.esquerda.net/artigo/bloco-quer-acabar-com-apoios-públicos-às-touradas/23798</ref> and, in another instance, rating the show to an adults-only classification.<ref>http://www.atelevisao.com/geral/bloco-de-esquerda-quer-classificar-tourada-como-programa-para-maiores-de-18anos/</ref>
==References== {{Reflist}}
{{Bullfighting}} {{Portugal topics}}
[[Category:Bullfighting in Portugal]] [[Category:Bull sports]]

{{Use dmy dates|date=November 2018}} {{Use Indian English|date=November 2018}} {{Infobox stadium | image = | stadium_name = Shivaji Hockey Stadium | fullname = Shivaji Hockey Stadium | nickname = Shivaji Stadium | location = [[New Delhi]], [[India]] | coordinates = | built = 1964 | opened = 1964 | rebuilt = 2008 | owner = [[Government of Delhi|New Delhi Municipal Corporation]] | operator = [[Government of Delhi|New Delhi Municipal Corporation]] | construction_cost = | architect = | former_names = Shivaji Stadium | seating_capacity = 7,000 | tenants = [[India women's national field hockey team]] | dimensions = }} '''Shivaji Hockey Stadium''' is a hockey stadium located in [[New Delhi]], [[India]]. The stadium was one that was selected to host hockey matches for [[2010 Commonwealth Games]] but stadium was not ready before the games as construction of seating facilities and one venues which was come [[Concerns and controversies over the 2010 Commonwealth Games|controversies of Commonwealth Games]].<ref>[http://sports.ndtv.com/othersports/news/171968-ndmc-slammed-over-cwg-renovations NDMC slammed over CWG renovations]</ref><ref>{{cite news | url=https://www.ndtv.com/sports-news/cwg-hockey-stadium-set-to-miss-deadline-426850 | title=CWG: Hockey stadium set to miss deadline | date=11 August 2010 | publisher=NDTV | accessdate=4 November 2018 }}</ref>
In 2004, the stadium was identified as home for India women's hockey team and selected venue for the practice venue for [[hockey]] and [[swimming (sport)|swimming]] but later its changed to [[Dhyan Chand National Stadium]] and [[SPM Swimming Pool Complex]].<ref>[http://sports.ndtv.com/hockey/news/186963-finally-shivaji-stadium-likely-to-be-ready Finally, Shivaji Stadium likely to be ready]</ref><ref>[http://sports.ndtv.com/hockey/news/20418-womens-team-flayed-for-poor-performance Women's team flayed for poor performance]</ref><ref>[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/indiahome/article-2214747/Hockey-returns-Delhis-Shivaji-Stadium-years.html Hockey returns to Delhi's Shivaji Stadium after five years]</ref>
The stadium has been a host for games of India's [[UBA Pro Basketball League]] as well.<ref>[http://www.indiansportsnews.com/other-sports/basketball-news/38643-uba-pro-basketball-league-pune-peshwas-hyderabad-sky-register-wins UBA Pro Basketball League: Pune Peshwas, Hyderabad Sky register wins] ''Indian Sports News'', 29 February 2016. Accessed 1 May 2017.</ref>
== Features ==
* Synthetic surfaces * Parking lot of 1500 vehicles with multi-levels * Changing rooms, physio rooms etc.
==Transport==
[[Shivaji Stadium metro station]] is just under a Km from Shivaji Hockey Stadium.
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== * [http://www.cwgdelhi2010.org/dcwg/?q=node/785/ 2010 Commonwealth Hockey Stadium]

[[Florence–Darlington Technical College|Florence–Darlington Tech]] Stingers | embedded = | website = | publictransit = }} '''Clifford S. Cormell Field at Sparrow Stadium''' is a [[baseball stadium]] on the campus of [[Francis Marion University]] in [[Florence, South Carolina]]. Part of the $11.1 million R. Gerald Griffin Athletic Complex, Sparrow Stadium is the home field for the [[Francis Marion Patriots]] baseball team. Sparrow Stadium also hosts some home games for the [[Florence–Darlington Technical College]] Stingers baseball team.{{cite web |title=Baseball Schedule |url=http://stingerathletics.com/baseball/schedule |website=stingerathletics.com |publisher=Florence–Darlington Technical College |accessdate=August 12, 2018}} Sparrow Stadium is the home field of the [[Florence RedWolves]] of the [[Coastal Plain League]], a [[List of collegiate summer baseball leagues|collegiate summer baseball league]]. The RedWolves moved to Sparrow Stadium in the middle of the 2012 season because Florence's [[American Legion Field (Florence)|American Legion Field]], built in 1968, no longer met Coastal Plain League standards, lacking a visitors clubhouse and having questionable field conditions.{{cite news |last1=Reichard |first1=Kevin |title=RedWolves moving to FMU ballpark |url=https://ballparkdigest.com/201205304943/college-baseball/news/redwolves-moving-to-fmu-ballpark |website=Ballpark Digest |publisher=August Publications |accessdate=August 12, 2018 |date=May 30, 2012}}{{cite news |last1=Haselden |first1=Mark |title=RedWolves, Francis Marion make stadium deal official |url=https://www.scnow.com/sports/article_eb81f444-5ce5-5bbb-bd74-9acb8a06cb03.html |accessdate=August 12, 2018 |work=[[SCNow]] |publisher=[[BH Media|BH Media Group, Inc.]] |date=June 14, 2012 |language=en |quote=Florence’s first game at Sparrow Stadium is scheduled for July 7 against the Wilson Tobs.}} Sparrow Stadium hosted the Coastal Plain League All-Star Game on July 12, 2015.{{cite news |last1=Bundy |first1=Sam |title=Sparrow Stadium a place where RedWolves, league can shine |url=https://www.scnow.com/news/article_fb62b200-290c-11e5-909f-d3b2d3969e53.html |accessdate=August 12, 2018 |work=[[SCNow]] |publisher=[[BH Media|BH Media Group, Inc.]] |date=July 12, 2015 |language=en}} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.florenceredwolves.com/ Florence RedWolves] - official site * [http://www.coastalplain.com/ Coastal Plain League] - official site {{CPL Ballparks}} {{SouthCarolina-baseball-venue-stub}} [[Category:College baseball venues in the United States]] [[Category:Sports venues in Florence County, South Carolina]] [[Category:Baseball venues in South Carolina]] [[Category:Buildings and structures in Florence, South Carolina]] [[Category:2012 establishments in South Carolina]] [[Category:Sports venues completed in 2012]] [[Category:Francis Marion Patriots baseball]]

page.title: Under Armour Undeniable Performance ESPY Award

revision.comment: Rescuing 1 sources and tagging 0 as dead. #IABot (v2.0beta)
revision.text:
The '''Under Armour Undeniable Performance [[ESPY Award]]''' was only awarded once, in [[2006 in sports|2006]], on the player, irrespective of gender or nationality, adjudged to have made, in a given [[calendar year]], the most significant, remarkable, and ''[[wikt:undeniable|undeniable]]'' performance in a single [[regular season]] or [[playoff]] game contested [[professional sports|professional]]ly under the auspices of one of the four [[Major professional sports leagues of the United States and Canada|major North American leagues]] or [[college sports|collegiately]] under the auspices of the [[National Collegiate Athletic Association]]. The award was one of [[ESPY Awards#Sponsored categories|two corporate-sponsored ESPYs]]; the [[Under Armour|titular sponsor]] designates criteria for selection consistent with its advertising campaigns.
Balloting for the award was conducted over the [[Internet]] by [[fan (aficionado)|fan]]s from amongst between three and five choices selected by the ESPN Select Nominating Committee. At the time, the [[ESPY Awards#Ceremonies|ESPY Awards ceremony]] was conducted in June (it is now held in July) and awards conferred reflect performance and achievement over the twelve months preceding presentation.
==List of winners== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size: 95%;" |- style="white-space: nowrap;" !style="background: #e3e3e3;"|Year of award !style="background: #e3e3e3;"|Date !style="background: #e3e3e3;"|Game or event !style="background: #e3e3e3;"|Venue !style="background: #e3e3e3;"|Competition, governing body, or league !style="background: #e3e3e3;"|Competing teams !style="background: #e3e3e3;"|Sport !style="background: #e3e3e3;"|Player and performance |- |[[2006 in sports|2006]] |22 January 2006 |[[2005-06 NBA season|2005-06 regular season game]] |[[Staples Center]] ---- [[Los Angeles]], [[California]], [[United States]] |[[National Basketball Association]] |[[Los Angeles Lakers]] ---- [[Toronto Raptors]] |[[Basketball]] |In his side's 122-104 victory, Lakers [[shooting guard]] [[Kobe Bryant]] converts 21 of 33 [[field goal (basketball)|two-point field goal]]s, 7 of 13 [[three-point shot|three-point field goal]]s, and 18 of 20 [[free throw]]s attempted to score 81 [[point (basketball)|point]]s, more in [[List of National Basketball Association players with 60 or more points in a game|a single game]] than any player save [[Wilt Chamberlain]] (100 in the [[1961-62 NBA season|1961-62 season]]) |}
==See also== *[[Best Moment ESPY Award]] *[[Best Play ESPY Award]] *[[Best Record-Breaking Performance ESPY Award]] *[[GMC Professional Grade Play ESPY Award]]
==External links== *[http://webarchive.loc.gov/all/20020223000325/http://www.hickoksports.com/history/espyawrd.shtml#undperf Enumeration of past winners from HickokSports.com]
{{ESPYs}}

page.title: United States Olympic Hall of Fame

revision.text:
{{unreferenced|date=July 2018}} The '''[[United States]] Olympic Hall of Fame''' is an honor roll of the top American Olympic athletes.
The [[Hall of Fame]] was established by the [[United States Olympic Committee]] in [[1979 in sports|1979]]; the first members were inducted in 1983. Between 1992 and 2003, the Hall of Fame went dormant, with no induction of new members. In 2004, the honor was revived, and continued in 2005 when the 'Class of 2006' was selected.
The current process for selecting inductees is two-staged. Fifteen finalists are selected by a nominating committee consisting of athletes, members of the U.S. Olympic Hall of Fame, historians and USOC representatives. The inductees were then selected based on online voting at www.usolympicteam.com, with a requirement to select five individual athletes, one team, one [[Paralympic Games|Paralympian]] and one coach. When the inductees are announced, a veteran and a "special contributor" are also included.
According to a 2012 press release, total membership has been brought to 96 Olympians, five Paralympians, 10 teams, four coaches, 10 veterans, 16 contributors and two Olive Branch award inductees.
In the past the Hall of Fame has sought to construct a museum, but construction has not begun due to a lack of sponsorship.

{{for|the [[gymnasium (Germany)|gymnasium]] (senior high school/sixth form college) in [[Pocking]], [[Bavaria]], Germany (acronym WDG)|Wilhelm-Diess-Gymnasium}} The '''World Disc Games''' ('''WDG''') is a semi-regular event that brings the entire world [[flying disc]] community together for a week of overall disc events that allow people to compete in and enjoy disc sports. Beginning in 1978, and originally called the Santa Cruz Flying Disc Classic, the WDG has its home in [[Santa Cruz, California]], with promoter and [[hall of fame]] disc sport player Tom Schot.<ref>{{cite web|title=Tom Schot|url=http://www.discgolfhalloffame.org/tom-schot/|work=Disc Golf Hall of Fame|accessdate=May 8, 2013}}</ref>
Disc sports competitions at the WDG include [[Ultimate (sport)|ultimate]], [[Flying disc freestyle|freestyle]], [[disc golf]], discathon, self-caught flight, accuracy, distance, and [[double disc court]]. In July 2003, World Disc Games X held in [[Santa Cruz, California|Santa Cruz]] with over 500 participants. More World Disc Games are planned for 2007 and beyond.

[[Åtvidabergs FF]]–[[IFK Norrköping]] (0–4) }} {{location map+ |Sweden Östergötland |float=right |width=270 |caption=Locations of the two clubs in [[Östergötland County|Östergötland]].|places= {{Location map~ |Sweden Östergötland |lat=58.60 |long=16.20 |label={{nobreak|[[Idrottsparken|IFK Norrköping]]}}}} {{location map~ |Sweden Östergötland |lat=58.20 |long=16.00 |label={{nobreak|[[Kopparvallen|Åtvidabergs FF]]}}}} }} '''Östgötaderbyt''' (lit. The Östergötland Derby) is the fixture between the two [[association football]] clubs [[IFK Norrköping]] and [[Åtvidabergs FF]], it is a [[local derby]] in [[Östergötland County|Östergötland]], Sweden and a fierce [[List of association football club rivalries by country|rivalry]]. The derby is commonly known as Östgötaderbyt, although this is a generic term that could be used for any fixture between two clubs in Östergötland.{{cite web | url=http://www.offside.org/de-tre-redaktorerna/2013/ostgotaderby-en-bekannelse | title=Östgötaderby! En bekännelse. | publisher=Offside | work=offside.org | accessdate=12 November 2014 | language=Swedish}} The rivalry has arisen because the two clubs are the most successful clubs in Östergötland. The two clubs have also played most seasons in the top tier league [[Allsvenskan]] of all Östergötland clubs and they are also the two out of just three Östergötland clubs to have won the [[List of Swedish football champions|Swedish football championship]], IFK Norrköping with 12 titles and Åtvidabergs FF with 2 titles. The majority of the matches between the two clubs have taken place in Allsvenskan, but fixtures have also taken place in [[Swedish Football Division 2|Division 2]] and [[Superettan]].{{cite web | url=http://www.atvidabergsff.se/affsenior/nyheter/542771/kartlaggning-ifk-norrkoping?year=2014 | title=Kartläggning IFK Norrköping | publisher=Åtvidabergs FF | work=atvidabergsff.se | date=21 September 2014 | accessdate=12 November 2014 | language=Swedish}} As of the [[2017 in Swedish football|2017 season]], IFK Norrköping are competing in Allsvenskan, and Åtvidabergs FF are in Superettan. ==Matches== {{Updated|22 September 2014}} {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%; text-align: center" |- ! rowspan="2" | ! rowspan="2" | Matches ! colspan="2" | Wins ! rowspan="2" | Draws ! colspan="2" | Goals ! rowspan="7" | ! colspan="2" | Home wins ! colspan="2" | Home draws ! colspan="2" | Away wins |- ! style="color:#ffffff; background:#303090; width:5em"| Åtvidaberg ! style="color:#003399; background:#ffffff;"| Norrköping ! style="color:#ffffff; background:#303090; width:5em"| Åtvidaberg ! style="color:#003399; background:#ffffff;"| Norrköping ! style="color:#ffffff; background:#303090; width:5em"| Åtvidaberg ! style="color:#003399; background:#ffffff;"| Norrköping ! style="color:#ffffff; background:#303090; width:5em"| Åtvidaberg ! style="color:#003399; background:#ffffff;"| Norrköping ! style="color:#ffffff; background:#303090; width:5em"| Åtvidaberg ! style="color:#003399; background:#ffffff;"| Norrköping |- | [[Allsvenskan]] || 36 || 10 || 18 || 8 || || || || || || || || |- | [[Superettan]] || 12 || 1 || 7 || 4 || || || || || || || || |- | [[Swedish football Division 2|Division 2]] || 6 || 0 || 6 || 0 || || || || || || || || |- | [[Svenska Cupen]] || 3 || 2 || 1 || 0 || || || || || || || || |- !
